story: The Grand Library requires a comprehensive scroll on mutability and aliasing. Your explanation will help future adventurers avoid dangerous bugs.
instructions: Explain how mutability interacts with aliasing, why it can cause surprising side effects, and how to safely copy objects. Include at least one concrete example of an aliasing bug.

explainRubric.description: Explains what aliasing is (multiple names for same object)
Mentions surprising side effects from aliasing

hints.text: Start with an example: `a = [1, 2]; b = a; b.append(3)` results in `a` also having 3 because both names refer to the same list.
Explain that mutable objects (lists, dicts, sets) can be changed in place, so all aliases see the changes.
Mention safe copying: `b = a.copy()`, `b = a[:]`, or `b = list(a)` create independent lists.

title: Explain: Mutability & Aliasing Mental Model
